results.name: Number A(n,k) of permutations p of [n] with no fixed points and displacement of elements restricted by k: 1 <= |p(i)-i| <= k, square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Conjecture: Column k > 0 has a linear recurrence (with constant coefficients) of order = A005317(k) = (2^k + C(2*k,k))/2. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 07 2015
From _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 07 2015: (Start) For k > 1, A(n,k) ~ c(k) * d(k)^n
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..36, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, s, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(n+k in s,
mathematica: b[n_, s_, k_] := b[n, s, k] = If[n==0, 1, If[MemberQ[s, n+k], b[n-1, Join[s ~Complement~ {n+k}] ~Union~ If[n-k>1, {n-k-1}, {}], k], Sum[If[j==n, 0, b[n -1, Join[s ~Complement~ {j}] ~Union~ If[n-k>1, {n-k-1}, {}], k]], {j, s}]] ];
Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 29 2017, translated from Maple *)
